author: COMSOL
description: This tutorial shows how to set up a multi-element objective lens. The chosen lens is a Petzval lens with field flattener described in 'Fundamental Optical Design', by M. Kidger, 2001, p.Â 192. The tutorial demonstrates how to include a geometric sequence using the 'Spherical Lens 3D' part found in the Ray Optics Module Part Library. Also demonstrated are the use of clear apertures, as well as edge and aperture obstructions. Finally, the results of a grid-based ray trace at several different wavelengths and field angles are shown graphically.
label: petzval_lens.mph
name: root

settings.name: commentsinfile
settings.value:
Spherical Lens 3D

Spherical lens with either concave or convex surfaces. The lens surface diameters can be smaller than the outer diameter. Clear apertures which are smaller than the lens surface diameters can be specified.

settings.name: commentsinfile
settings.value:
Circular Planar Annulus

Circular planar annulus with negligible thickness.

settings.name: commentsinfile
settings.value:
Rectangular Planar Annulus

Rectangular planar annulus with negligible thickness.
